verses.text: There was a man in the land of Uz , whose name \add was\add* Job ; and that man was perfect and upright , and one that feared God , and eschewed evil.
And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.

His substance also was seven thousand sheep , and three thousand camels , and five hundred yoke of oxen , and five hundred she asses , and a very great household ; so that this man was the greatest of all the men of the east.\f + \fr 1.3 \ft substance: or, cattle\f*\f + \fr 1.3 \ft household: or, husbandry\f*\f + \fr 1.3 \ft men: Heb. sons\f* \p
And his sons went and feasted \add in their\add* houses , every one his day ; and sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.

And it was so, when the days of \add their\add* feasting were gone about , that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning , and offered burnt offerings \add according\add* to the number of them all: for Job said , It may be that my sons have sinned , and cursed God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually.\f + \fr 1.5 \ft continually: Heb. all the days\f* \p

¶ Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and Satan came also among them.\f + \fr 1.6 \ft Satan: Heb. the adversary\f*\f + \fr 1.6 \ft among: Heb. in the midst of\f*

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto Satan , Whence comest thou? Then Satan answered the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and said , From going to and fro in the earth , and from walking up and down in it.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Satan , Hast thou considered my servant Job , that \add there is\add* none like him in the earth , a perfect and an upright man , one that feareth God , and escheweth evil ?\f + \fr 1.8 \ft considered: Heb. set thy heart on\f*
Then Satan answered the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and said , Doth Job fear God for nought ?

Hast not thou made an hedge about him, and about his house , and about all that he hath on every side ? thou hast blessed the work of his hands , and his substance is increased in the land.\f + \fr 1.10 \ft substance: or, cattle\f*
But put forth thine hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will curse thee to thy face.\f + \fr 1.11 \ft and he…: Heb. if he curse thee not to thy face\f*

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto Satan , Behold, all that he hath \add is\add* in thy power ; only upon himself put not forth thine hand. So Satan went forth from the presence of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 1.12  t power: Heb. hand * \p
¶ And there was a day when his sons and his daughters \add were\add* eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house :
And there came a messenger unto Job , and said , The oxen were plowing , and the asses feeding beside them:
And the Sabeans fell \add upon them\add*, and took them away ; yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword ; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.

While he \add was\add* yet speaking , there came also another, and said , The fire of God is fallen from heaven , and hath burned up the sheep , and the servants , and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.\f + \fr 1.16 \ft The fire…: or, A great fire\f*

While he \add was\add* yet speaking , there came also another, and said , The Chaldeans made out three bands , and fell upon the camels , and have carried them away , yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword ; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.\f + \fr 1.17 \ft fell: Heb. rushed\f*
While he \add was\add* yet speaking , there came also another, and said , Thy sons and thy daughters \add were\add* eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house :

And, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness , and smote the four corners of the house , and it fell upon the young men , and they are dead ; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.\f + \fr 1.19 \ft from…: Heb. from aside, etc\f* \p
Then Job arose , and rent his mantle , and shaved his head , and fell down upon the ground , and worshipped ,\f + \fr 1.20 \ft mantle: or, robe\f*

And said , Naked came I out of my mother’s womb , and naked shall I return thither: the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* gave , and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath taken away ; blessed be the name of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
In all this Job sinned not, nor charged God foolishly.\f + \fr 1.22 \ft charged…: or, attributed folly to God\f*
